technology.short_description: One of the most impressive, iconic sights of an Elven warhost is the wall of spears, perfectly arranged for maximum effect.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for High Elf Spearmen, Lothern Sea Guard and Silverin Guard

technology.short_description: All citizens of Ulthuan must join a militia and attend regular training, by order of the Phoenix King.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units

technology.short_description: The world's best archers require the very best arrows.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avalorn and Tiranoc Chariot units
Missile strength: +10% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Chariot units

technology.short_description: In times of war, it is best to be prepared for the long haul.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units

technology.short_description: Among the Asur, unflinching, unending war has a distinctive rhythm all its own.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth, Sisters of Avelorn and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: Forward! For Ulthuan! For the Phoenix King! Charrrrrge!

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Chariot units
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers, Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: The hotter it is, the wilder the beast, so intrinsic is fire to their nature.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Phoenix and Dragon units
Weapon strength: +10% for Phoenix and Dragon units

technology.short_description: Both the song and the singer are crucial if Dragon and rider are to form a bond that lasts a lifetime.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Dragon units
Melee defence: +5 for Dragon units

technology.short_description: Try and stay in the ship. That's the first lesson and it will keep you alive!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.short_description: Those among the Sea Guard who show better-than-average aptitude may find themselves promoted in due course.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.short_description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Spearmen, Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow Walkers, Rangers, Silverin Guard and Sisters of Avelorn units

technology.short_description: Some of the Asur's coastal colonies have fallen into disrepair and many colonists have maritime skills that could be useful to the Sea Guard at home.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.short_description: Those of noble birth have the time to become well practiced in war's terrible arts.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Silver Helms, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Chariot units

technology.short_description: The Elves of Tiranoc all know its battle song, a rousing anthem sung by their number since ancient times.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Chariot units
Charge bonus: +10 for Chariot units

technology.short_description: Nobility obliges me to recognise the virtue of an exceptional commoner.

effects.description: Leadership: +10 for embedded Heroes
Charge bonus: +10 for Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: It's not what you know but who.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -4%

technology.short_description: Barding of this kind gives the Reavers' mounts extra protection whilst they deliver their devastating charges.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Ellyrian Reavers units

technology.short_description: It is both the right and duty of Ulthuan's perfect cavalry to repeat the achievements of their glorious ancestors.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -6%

technology.short_description: Being able to control your steed with only your knees frees up the hands for blade, point or bow.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Ellyrian Reavers units
Range: +10% for Ellyrian Reaver Archers units

technology.short_description: The deadliest part of Ulthuan's armies just got deadlier.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Ellyrian Reavers units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Ellyrian Reavers units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Upkeep: -2%

technology.short_description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units
Armour: +10 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: Only the very best blades are made from star-metal; only Dwarfen gromril comes close in hardness and strength.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
Weapon strength: +5% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Upkeep: -3%

technology.short_description: The finest suits of armour are forged in the Anvil of Vaul at Caledor, and contain the Smith-God's protection.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Dragon Princes units
Ward save: 5% for Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Knowledge of the end informs the individual and guides their actions.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Phoenix Guard units
Ward save: 5% for Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: It takes centuries to become this good, but the Asur have time on their side.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.short_description: Whereby bolts and arrows can be stored for swift access when the ebb and flow of battle demands.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Tiranoc Chariot units

technology.short_description: The finest sons of the Ulthuan nobility, acting as one, without hesitation, to bring death to their homeland's enemies.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Silver Helms units
Charge bonus: +10 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Silver Helms units

technology.short_description: Minor nobles often choose a patron from more prestigious quarters, swearing allegiance to their house.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Silver Helms and Chariot units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Silver Helms and Chariot units

technology.short_description: When a course takes several centuries to complete, you can be sure that its students know their subject inside and out.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth and Mages

technology.short_description: Certain creatures are highly attuned to the Winds of Magic, making them that little bit more sensitive to the benefits of enchantment.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Phoenix units
Ward save: 5% for Phoenix units

technology.short_description: Oft times, pride comes afore a fall. Not in this case.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmaster, Phoenix Guard, Sisters of Avelorn and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: The Naggarothi expend much energy and resources in trying to steal Dragon Eggs, prompting their Asur cousins to ward their allies' ancient lairs against infiltration.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Great Eagle, Phoenix, War Lions and Dragon units

technology.short_description: The cadence of military music enables the maintenance of order and discipline in the fray's desperate, blood-soaked moments.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for Spearmen, Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Rangers, Silverin Guard, Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.short_description: An eagle's senses match their speed in flight, making them excellent spotters and swift killers.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for Great Eagle and War Lion units
Charge bonus: +10 for Great Eagle and War Lion units

technology.short_description: Yes, they're sharp enough. Be sure not to put your hand anywhere near the end.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Great Eagle and War Lion units
Weapon strength: +10% for Great Eagle and War Lion units

technology.short_description: As many eagles and phoenixes hail from these huge magical mountains, it makes sense to foster new recruits here as early as possible.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Great Eagle, War Lions and Phoenix units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Great Eagle, War Lions and Phoenix units

technology.short_description: Wide, flat-headed arrows are both easy to store and more effective at slicing through massed ranks of the foe than standard designs.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower and Tiranoc Chariot units
Range: +10% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower and Tiranoc Chariot units

technology.short_description: Those hailing from Nagarythe are adept fletchers, using raven feathers to create their own lethal designs.

effects.description: Leadership: +10 for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers units
Missile resistance: 15% for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers units

technology.short_description: There is much to be learned at the Tower of Hoeth, be it history or swordplay.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee defence: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: The maidens of Avelorn invoke the lands which they protect, and Isha, the Mother, answers.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Handmaiden Heroes
Melee defence: +6 for Handmaiden and Sisters of Avelorn units
Physical resistance: 5% for Sisters of Avelorn and Handmaiden units

technology.short_description: Many herds of fine Elven steeds roam freely on Ulthuan's wide plains, but can be called to battle when needed.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for Chariot units
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers, Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Only when there is dire need can the most ancient examples be roused from their slumber.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Dragon units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Dragon units

technology.short_description: The renowned smiths of Vaul and Hoeth forge greatswords so light and well-balanced they appear to be no lighter than a feather.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Setting rare gems into jewellery made from precious metals increases their value manyfold.

effects.description: Income from Industry buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: Having a surplus of the finest building materials says something about a society's inherent wealth.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for all buildings

technology.short_description: "Pain, begone, I will have no more of thee!"

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5%

technology.short_description: Ulthuan's network of Waystones funnel the Winds of Magic towards the Vortex, ensuring tranquillity abounds within its enchanted cloak.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%
Hero action success chance: +5%

technology.short_description: Not everyone understands the true nature of the world's peril. Those who do are more willing to unite against the common enemy.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Where better for the ambitious individual to learn their craft than at a place of high intrigue and low plots?

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Handmaidens
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Nobles

technology.short_description: The calm, polite eloquence of the Asur ensures their easier acceptance by other cultures, where they may hear and even influence local intrigue.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +5 with all factions

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' prosperous economy to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Tradable resources produced: +5%

technology.short_description: War machines benefit greatly from solid construction using only the finest materials.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Chariot units
Melee defence: +5 for Chariot units

technology.short_description: Those who dare to sail to the far east return with rare luxury goods of which the lesser races can only imagine.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +10%

technology.short_description: Salting fish ensures it can be transported inland and still be edible by the time it gets there.

effects.description: Growth: +10
Income from Ports: +10%

technology.short_description: Elves are partial to the arts and enjoy festivals where poets and bards come to entertain the masses.

effects.description: Control: +2

technology.short_description: The play may be the thing, but a pleasant environment does much for the mood of the audience.

effects.description: Income from Entertainment buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: High Elf pottery is produced to a dazzlingly-high standard, as one might expect from a superior race. Naturally, its secrets are closely guarded.

effects.description: Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' ancient, glorious culture even further.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +5%

technology.short_description: Visibility is important; it not only ensures that you see events unfold, but that you are seen doing so.

effects.description: All sea regions are made visible to your faction
Construction cost: -15% for Ports
Construction time: -1 for Ports

technology.short_description: If only they could stop squabbling amongst themselves, then we would truly be invincible.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for High Elf Industry and Resource buildings
Construction time: -1 for High Elf Industry and Resource buildings

technology.short_description: Recaptured former colonies require less effort to orientate and acclimatise them to the Asur way.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Living on our fair isles of Ulthuan, set in the centre of the Great Ocean, we are far removed from the petty squabbles of the lesser races.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for High Elf Entertainment, Aristocracy and Embassy buildings
Construction time: -1 for High Elf Entertainment, Aristocracy and Embassy buildings
